title: Mobil launches 50% post-consumer recycled plastic pails in India - PR Newswire
summary: Mobil has launched an initiative to use 50% Post-Consumer Recycled (PCR) plastic pails for its lubricant products in India, aimed at reducing plastic waste and advancing sustainability. This initiative marks a significant step towards sustainable packaging, as it incorporates recycled materials and supports a circular economy. The company also claims to divert over 90% of lubricant operations waste from landfills. ExxonMobil continues to increase the production of certified circular plastics and operates one of the largest advanced recycling facilities in North America.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is green innovation because it involves the use of Post-Consumer Recycled plastics, which reduces plastic waste and promotes sustainability by advancing a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE: This is a business innovation because the initiative represents a new approach in the packaging of lubricant products, significantly different from previous methods by incorporating recycled materials.
green_product: TRUE: The 50% PCR plastic pails are a green product as they are designed with the goal of significantly reducing environmental impact by using recycled plastics.
green_process: TRUE: The recycling facility and processes described support a green process as they involve methods aimed at minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability through advanced recycling technologies.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing, 486110 - Crude Petroleum Extraction, 221118 - Other Electric Power Generation
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not appear to be an example of greenwashing, as it provides concrete evidence of commitments to sustainability and waste reduction, including operational achievements and certifications.
